link.synopsis: Oscar-winning Israeli director Dror Shaul exposes the rough edges of Israeli society in this biting comedy, in which a sweet grandmother (Tiki Dayan) has the power to put curses on people and grant blessings. She's in high demand, and at every turn there's someone who wants to use her gift for their own needs. Extras include commentary, deleted scenes, premiere and behind-the-scenes footage, the theme song music video, the trailer and TV ads.
link.title: synopsis
Turn Left at the End of the World

link.synopsis: Based on Charles William Bell's Broadway hit, this charming comedy stars Buster Keaton (in one of his few talkies) as dim-bulb ne'er-do-well Reginald Irving. He finds himself in over his head when stymied would-be groom Jeff Haywood (Reginald Denny) tries to pass Reggie off as a rich and eligible gent to woo the persnickety older sister of Jeff's fiancée. What ensues is a barrelful of laughs and confusion, culminating in a hilarious denouement.

link.synopsis: One of director Brian De Palma's earliest movies, The Wedding Party features Robert De Niro and Jill Clayburgh in their film debuts. The offbeat comedy follows the misadventures of Charlie (Charles Pfulger), who's set to wed Josephine (Clayburgh). But things spiral out of control when the church organist tries to seduce him, his pal Cecil (De Niro) slams marriage, and the groom-to-be misses his bachelor bash. Will jittery Charlie take the plunge?

link.synopsis: Shoot the curl and get tubular with this vintage surfing flick that includes a cast of cut-ups such as Fabian, Tab Hunter, Shelly Fabares, Barbara Eden and Jim Mitchum. Highlights include the ubiquitous clambake (on the beach, of course) and a wild surf contest to see who rules the waves. Directed by Don Taylor, this comedy includes some campy, wave-riding close-ups with the stars looking like the Wallendas tiptoeing on a high wire. Radical!

Beach Blanket Bingo / How to Stuff a Wild Bikini

link.synopsis: Five kids devise a plan to rescue a sea lion named Slappy from an aquarium and free him from his detested life in the tank. But what the kids haven't worked into their plan is the fact that Slappy's already been marked for kidnapping by a heartless mercenary (Bronson Pinchot) who plans on selling the endearing, rambunctious sea lion to a Bulgarian circus. B.D. Wong and Jennifer Coolidge co-star in this gentle comedy directed by Barnet Kellman.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Director Juliusz Machulski's bawdy, fun comedy envisions a world where the only men left are Albert (Olgierd Lukaszewicz) and Maks (Jerzy Stuhr), two pals spared destruction because they were frozen as part of an experiment. When they awaken, the League of Women's Lib runs the planet, and their archeologists believe Albert and Maks are a species predating the female human race. Can the men repopulate the globe with their gender? Contains nudity.

link.synopsis: This ensemble romantic comedy stars Eugene Byrd, Eddie Griffin Jr., Donn Swaby and Maurice Patton as four tight-knit pals who leave gritty New York City and make their way to sun-kissed Los Angeles hoping to find fame and fortune in Hollywood. But the road to the top is marked with potholes and barriers in the form of women who leave the guys confused, dizzy and distracted -- and who may even put their ironclad friendships in jeopardy.
link.title: synopsis
Love and Other Four Letter Words

link.synopsis: Director Allan Moyle helms this drama that captures dichotomy of one of the most controversial entertainers of all time -- pop megastar Michael Jackson, aka "The Gloved One." From legions of adoring fans and multi-platinum albums to over-the-top plastic surgeries and recent scandals, The King of Pop (played by Flex Alexander) has become a fascinating enigma. And this movie, like its subject, treads a fine line between outrageous comedy and drama.

link.synopsis: With dreams of becoming gangsta rappers, Iowa white boy Flip (Danny Hoch) and his pals (Mark Webber and Dash Mihok) adopt the style of urban hip-hoppers -- and the locals think they're plain crazy. When Khalid (Eugene Byrd) moves to town, the boys convince their new black friend to take them to Chicago and hook them up with everything ghetto. The comedy features cameos and music by Snoop Dog, Fat Joe, Dead Prez and Slick Rick.

Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas

link.synopsis: In this out-of-this-world anime comedy series, notoriously unlucky Ataru Moroboshi is chosen at random by aliens and told that only he can save Earth by defeating their sexy princess, Lum, in a game of tag. Unaware that Lum can fly, girl-crazy Ataru agrees to play. Ataru's girlfriend Shinobi, hoping to boost his morale, agrees to marry him if he wins. But just as things are looking up for Ataru, Lum moves in with marriage plans of her own.

link.synopsis: Showcasing some of Hollywood's brightest stars, "The Colgate Comedy Hour" was a hit when it began airing in September 1950. With no standing host during its five-and-a-half-year run, the musical variety program enlisted numerous celebrities to announce the acts. Two of the show's most entertaining performers were Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis, and this collection highlights many of the popular duo's memorable appearances.

link.synopsis: When financial worries, stress and misery overwhelm six middle-aged men, they make a pact to kill themselves. But their suicidal intentions are delayed after several unexpected events force them to give life another chance. Fate leads the men down a hilarious path of hardship to repositories of strength they didn't know they possessed in this male angst comedy directed by Barbara Wong. George Lam and Ekin Cheng lead the ensemble cast.
link.title: synopsis
Truth or Dare: 6th Floor Rear Flat

link.synopsis: A ragtag group of boys try to save their favorite summer camp in this heartwarming comedy. When the owner of Camp Kobie dies, his heartless son Richard decides to make a bundle by selling the property. Hoping to change Richard's mind, the oddball campers and their dedicated counselor (Bradley Gallo) work as a team to create the coolest -- and most hilarious -- summer camp in history. Miko Hughes, Jimmy McQuaid and Adam Busch also star.
link.title: synopsis
I Could Never Be Your Woman

link.synopsis: George Krikkos (Tom Bastounes) is a former playboy who knows he's past his prime in this unusual romantic comedy. Divorced and lacking direction, he sometimes takes respite by singing at a nearby watering hole -- where, one day, he runs into an ex (Monica Zaffarano) who's made it big as an opera singer. Remarkably, they hook up for one night and decide to sing together as a publicity stunt, but soon, old feelings begin to resurface.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
I Love You, Don't Touch Me
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: No secret is safe from salon owner Big Mama Lucille and her outlandish hairstylists in this production of Shelley Garrett's rollicking comedy. Big Mama may be pint-sized, but she's got a firecracker attitude and sexy smarts, and she runs her salon like the gossip central it is, where every speck of scandal rinses out in the shampoo sink. The surprises keep coming at Big Mama's Beauty Shop in this sidesplitting production.

link.synopsis: Talk about politically incorrect! This no-holds-barred movie pushes some touchy buttons by asking such questions as, "What makes one situation funny and another unfunny?" Or "Why are some jokes never told in mixed company?" It's a comedy insurrection that's sure to make offended politically correct pundits wince and head for the hills. For those who dare to remain, prepare to laugh yourself silly!

link.synopsis: In this comedy set in contemporary Dublin, Clara (Fiona O'Shaughnessy) is stunned when she finds her boyfriend kissing someone else (Fiona Glascott), setting in motion a string of romantic mishaps for the heartbroken woman and several other lovelorn characters. Marriage, casual encounters and everything in between are explored by this group of relationship-challenged people who ultimately just want the same thing: someone to call their own.

link.synopsis: Dean Martin and Shirley MacLaine star in this sweet 1961 comedy about Tony Ryder (Martin), who takes over the duties of magazine publisher when his uncle dies suddenly, supposedly while spending time with a mistress. Worried that the news will besmirch his magazine's wholesome reputation, Tony hires a detective to find out who the mistress is, but mistakenly identifies the publication's researcher, Katie Robbins (MacLaine), as the secret lover.

link.synopsis: Scientist Fred Miller (Tony Randall) will do anything in the name of science in this rib-tickling comedy. That's why he's agreed to live for one month underwater, in a home created especially for that purpose. His wife, Vivian (Janet Leigh), and his kids, however, aren't as enthusiastic about the enterprise. In spite of their misgivings, they go along with it anyway. But as expected, human nature has a way of messing up the best-laid plans.

link.synopsis: Washed-up comedian Hollaback (Mike Troy Smith) used to be the hottest performer on the stand-up circuit, but now he can't get a gig anywhere. Fame is fleeting, as they say, but this comedian's determined to revive his career -- and the more he hears "No," the angrier he gets. One by one, Hollaback takes revenge on anyone who stands in the way of his comedy comeback. Mike Yard, Wil Slyvince and Arnold Acevedo also star.

link.synopsis: San Francisco comics of the 1950s, '60s and '70s knew that if they wanted to make it big and show they were ready for fame's klieg lights, they'd have to prove their talent onstage at the Hungry I nightclub. The famous nightspot, a perfect training ground for stand-up, boasts an alumni list that reads like a who's who of comedy, some of whom -- including Lenny Bruce, Bill Cosby and Jonathan Winters -- returned for this hilarious reunion.

But it all comes together in a strangely intoxicating brew -- one that details the off-the-wall events that unfold decades after a UFO lands in the town of Trafalgar.

link.synopsis: Martin Short reprises the role he made famous, that of showbiz maven and combustible talk-show host Jiminy Glick, in this offbeat comedy. Glick is soaking in the atmosphere at the Toronto Film Festival, where he's determined to make his mark. When he snags an interview with superstar Ben DiCarlo (Corey Pearson), Glick's profile receives a much-needed jolt, but matters turn seamy when an aging actress is found dead in his bed.

link.synopsis: World War II has just ended, and young Everett Laidlaw (Christopher Rydell), who had joined the battle overseas to avoid jail for moonshining, returns home and reunites with his kin. But surviving the war will soon seem like a cakewalk for Everett as he deals with his wacky family and struggles with coming of age in small-town America. Hoyt Axton, Karen Black and Pamela Springsteen (sister of rock star Bruce) costar in this sweet comedy.

link.synopsis: Idealistic Nora (Annette O'Toole) and her husband, Phil (Lyn Vaus), always said they weren't in the porn biz for the money. But when their mainstream sexy movie business goes broke and they stumble upon salacious archive video of a famous TV star, they must decide whether to cash in. Elisabeth Moss also stars in this dark comedy.

link.synopsis: Gerry Trent (Gloria Swanson, in her talking-picture debut) owns a popular dress shop and specializes in haute couture for discerning ladies. Sick and tired of her philandering boyfriend, Jim Woodward (Monroe Owsley), Gerry dumps him on New Year's Eve. Soon after, she falls for writer Anthony Blake (Ben Lyon), who's just penned the best-seller &NFi;Obey Thy Impulse&NFi_; … and that they do, in this frothy comedy directed by Leo McCarey.

Enjoy this collection of five of their early works -- "Hustling for Health," "The Paperhangers Helper," "Lucky Dog," "The Soilers" and "Roughest Africa" -- before they created the characters for which they became known.

link.synopsis: American Hank Dussard (Dean Jones) inherits a ramshackle olive plantation in France and is determined to restore the property. Problem is, he needs laborers with small fingers and a gentle touch to harvest the olives. Dussard's novel idea? Import a quartet of trained chimps with dexterous digits to do the work. Talk about monkey business. Maurice Chevalier (in his last role) and Yvette Mimieux co-star in this Disney family comedy.

link.synopsis: They've been together for years, and now, Ameere (Mike Davis) has finally proposed to his longtime love, Jacquelyn (Shawn Schaffer). But before they say "I do," there's still a no-holds-barred bachelor party to throw for Ameere. As big as this bash is, it's not the only thing that threatens to eclipse the big day: Ameere's got a secret that could derail the couple's whole future. Will Wright co-stars in writer-director Gideon's uproarious comedy.

link.synopsis: During one of the hottest weeks of the year, door-to-door salesmen compete for a large cash prize to be given to the person who sells the most newspaper subscriptions. These hopeless individuals lie, cheat and do whatever it takes to end up on top. Set in inner-city Los Angeles, this dark comedy from writer-director Gabriel Avina depicts a test of persistence and scruples as each peddler attempts to outwit the other.
link.title: synopsis
Fright Club: Enter If You Dare
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail

link.synopsis: An assortment of motley characters from three families -- including philandering husbands, smarty-pants kids and a National Basketball Association draftee -- gathers for a big reunion after years of being apart. Hilarity ensues as simmering rivalries reignite and old grudges come to the surface in this entertaining urban comedy starring Marvin Gentry, Sherrice Eaglin, Nicole Fitzgerald and Dori Torel.
link.title: synopsis
Hot Chick Hot Rod Stoner BBQ
The Book of Ruth: Journey of Faith
Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen
Mom and Dad Save the World
The Best of Abbott and Costello: Vol. 3
The Best of Abbott and Costello: Vol. 4
The Bad News Bears Go to Japan!
The Bad News Bears in Breaking Training

link.synopsis: A con artist and irrepressible skirt-chaser fleeing the law ends up masquerading as a man of the cloth in a small-town church, but the randy trickster faces a tough choice after falling back on his wicked ways and blowing his cover. Can he end his sinful lifestyle and find redemption, or will he continue down his unholy road to ruin? Roy Ayers Jr., Leslie Boston and Victor Carr star in this entertaining urban comedy with a message.
link.title: synopsis
Keepin' the Faith: My Baby's Gettin' Married!
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed
Wu Tang: The Undaunted Wudang / Shaolin Instructional
The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington / The Happy Hooker Goes Hollywood
He Say, She Say, But What Does God Say?
Keepin' the Faith: Lookin' for Mr. Right

link.synopsis: The families of Angaarchand (Amrish Puri) and Lakshmidevi (Lakshmi) have been feuding for years. When Angaarchand's youngest son, Jai (Akshaye Khanna), and Lakshmidevi's granddaughter, Anjali (Kareena Kapoor), enroll at the same college, the game of revenge begins in earnest. Jai and Anjali each pretend to fall in love to deceive the other, but matters get sticky after their feigned feelings become genuine in this rib-tickling comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this story of two brothers, Rishi is lazy and wants riches without lifting a finger, while Rocky knows the value of hard work. Rishi is in love with Riya, and Rocky has fallen for Riya's sister Misha, but the women have been forbidden to see the brothers because their father is offended by Rishi's work ethic. When Rocky realizes he's being judged by his brother's actions, comedy ensues as he goes to extreme measures to win the father over.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: John Wayne appears in three classic shoot-'em-ups. In Angel and the Badman, the Duke's a gunfighter who must choose between the girl he loves (Gail Russell) and his guns. In Winds of the Wasteland, Wayne's a rugged Westerner who buys a stagecoach line to compete with the arrival of the telegraph. And in Mclintock, Wayne shows off his funny side (with Maureen O'Hara) in a comedy inspired by Shakespeare's "The Taming of the Shrew."
link.title: synopsis
Riders of Destiny / The Star Packer
West of the Divide / Texas Terror
Winds of the Wasteland / The Lucky Texan

title.regular: John Wayne: King of the West
title.short: John Wayne: King of the West

link.synopsis: When Martin (Carlos Leon) tells his religious parents he no longer believes in God, they quickly disown him. Martin then struggles to deal with his aunt Patricia (Karmin Murcelo), who thinks her nephew is possessed by the devil and is determined to see him either repent or die. Featuring running commentary from Jesus, Krishna, Zeus, Buddha and Muhammad, this biting comedy skewers a wide variety of world religions.
link.title: synopsis
The Book of Life: 2000 Seen By...
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
People Who Met Jesus: Series I

link.synopsis: Off-the-hook comedian Doo Doo Brown plays the leader of a group of carefree, unemployed homeys who set out for Atlanta in search of good times and fly ladies. But once they get there, our hapless heroes get much more than they bargained for. Directed by Velli (The Black Witch Project), this outrageous urban comedy also stars Tracy Johnson, Isaac Oderdian, Slyman Carter, CED-T, British and Janet Jack.
link.title: synopsis
Crips and Bloods: Made in America
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"

Platinum Comedy Series: Paul Rodriguez: Live in San Quentin

link.synopsis: Four engaging tales delve into Mexico's rich and wondrous past to explore universal themes of reality versus fantasy, comedy versus horror, honor versus greed, and love versus loneliness. This arresting collection of short films, each one gorgeously photographed, features a star turn by Hugo Stiglitz, the popular Mexican actor from the 1977 horror classic Tintorera: Killer Shark.
link.title: synopsis
Entre La Tarde y La Noche

link.synopsis: Set in an adult video shop on Christmas Eve, this indie comedy features plenty of chat about sex but none of the real thing. While most folks are home stuffing stockings, bumbling storeowner Joe (Joe Smith) and promiscuous store clerk Tina (Tina Carlucci) are preparing for the arrival of real-life porn star Dyanna Lauren. Dean Haspiel and Christian Urich portray a pair of gay security guards, and Adam Sarner plays Tina's opining ex-beau.
link.title: synopsis
Pornography: The Secret History of Civilization
Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special
Take the Flame: Gay Games: Grace, Grit & Glory
The Good, the Bad and the Beautiful / The Bikini Academy
The Triple B Collection: Fit to Kill
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: Double-crossed by a beautiful femme fatale, Lee Pa (Raymond Lui) becomes the target of every high-kicking assassin in town in this martial arts adventure. As he attempts to deliver a special sword to Golden Town, Lee engages in one fist-flying battle after another as an army of enemies tries to steal the weapon away. Lui also directs this action-packed kung fu comedy co-starring Lucifer Lee, Charlemina Hung, Paul Wei and Chi Kuan Chun.
link.title: synopsis
Half a Loaf of Kung Fu

link.synopsis: Despite aspirations of artistic greatness, booze-loving puppeteer and roofer Tuck (Duke Novak) worries his life is going nowhere. But an encounter with the lovely Suz (Mara Hesed) prompts Tuck to get his act together ... and become a race-car driver. Will Tuck's scheme win over tough-customer Suz, or will he just crash and burn? The offbeat indie comedy set in the Pacific Northwest marks the feature debut of writer-director Andrew McAllister.
link.title: synopsis
Love and Death on Long Island
A Love Song for Bobby Long

link.synopsis: This comprehensive look at the career of freewheeling, offbeat rapper Thirstin Howl III includes an exhaustive collection of music videos, comedy sketches, studio footage and interviews. The Brooklyn-based performer of Puerto Rican descent, who alternates freely between Spanish and English, shines on such tracks as "O.G. Stripes, Chapter One," "Love and Loyalty, Part 2" and the priceless "Still Live with My Moms."

link.synopsis: Camels invade Texas in this slapstick comedy about a military experiment gone wrong. When the horses of a Texas-based cavalry unit can't take the heat, Howard Clemmons (James Hampton) is charged with testing camels as an alternative. It's a bumpy ride at first, but the soldiers soon grow attached to their humped steeds. Mayhem ensues when the men are ordered to release the camels into the wild. Slim Pickens, Denver Pyle and Jack Elam also star.
link.title: synopsis
The Apple Dumpling Gang Rides Again
Tex Avery's Droopy: The Complete Theatrical Collection
The Bear Who Slept Through Christmas

link.synopsis: Middle-aged bookkeeper Harold Diddlebock (silent-film legend Harold Lloyd) gets the ax from his boss after 23 years of service. Following a drunken spree and a series of hilariously improbable events, mild-mannered Harold finds himself the proud but puzzled owner of a bankrupt circus -- which he plans to get rid of with help from a hungry lion. Jimmy Conlin and Margaret Hamilton costar in this zany comedy from director Preston Sturges.
link.title: synopsis

link.title: The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: Steve 5 (Jesse Woodrow) returns to his posh California suburb after a year away at college to find it radically changed in this black comedy. His friend Duff (Rene Heger) now heads a gang that's turned the neighborhood into a violent crime zone where a lifestyle of drugs and sex reigns. Drawn to Duff's new life, Steve 5 struggles to stay true to himself while also trying to win the love of the sexy but unattainable Heather (Paris Hilton).
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: High school friends Brittney Kornblum (Michelle Fairbanks) and Ally Koch (Maria Jones) have never competed against each other. But all bets are off after the brilliant Brittney constructs homicidal robots in a scheme to snare a cute boy (Matthew Jones) from Ally. Things escalate when Ally -- a superb athlete -- refuses to concede, and the ladies end up in a martial-arts battle royal in this uniquely entertaining, unbridled comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
Lone Wolf and Cub: Baby Cart at the River Styx

link.synopsis: The funniest moments of legendary comedy duo Bud Abbott and Lou Costello are captured in this choice collection of theatrical trailers, hit sketches, movie clips and hilarious outtakes. One of the biggest acts of the 1940s and '50s, Abbott and Costello kept audiences in stitches in a long string of films, many of which are excerpted here, including Abbott and Costello Meet Frankenstein and Abbott and Costello Meet the Killer, Boris Karloff.

link.synopsis: Teenage peeping tom Alex (Martin Yost) takes his obsession with sexy Sally (Heather Kennedy) to the next level when he starts a voyeuristic video production company in this racy comedy. With help from a buddy, Alex gets as much footage of Sally as possible, then turns his cameras on other unsuspecting victims. When the school principal threatens to ruin their fun, the maverick filmmakers decide their project could use a scandalous new scene.

Elite XC: Primetime: Kimbo vs. Colossus

link.synopsis: No history of 20th-century American comedy is complete without covering the contributions of the legendary Lucille Ball, whose early career is traced in this informative documentary. The film chronicles her stint as a chorus girl for Sam Goldwyn, her bit parts, her first big role in Stage Door and her fateful meeting with Desi Arnaz. Also included are Ball's appearances with the Marx Brothers, Bob Hope, Red Skelton and Abbott & Costello.

link.synopsis: This virtual "festival" of comedy celebrates the legendary Three Stooges with a collection of classic shorts including "Disorder in the Court" (1936), in which the Stooges are asked to testify at a friend's murder trial. Other highlights: "Heavenly Daze" (1948), in which Shemp's ascent to heaven is held up until he "reforms" Moe and Larry; and "Malace in the Palace" (1949), in which the boys hit the desert to recover a priceless diamond.

link.synopsis: Packed with rare interviews, film shorts, television footage and more, this lighthearted documentary details the history of the legendary classic comedy team. The careers of all six actors who played the Stooges over the years -- brothers Moe, Curly and Shemp Howard, Larry Fine, Joe Besser and Joe DeRita -- are examined, while new interviews with those who worked with the funnymen shed light on the enduring comic trio.

link.synopsis: This charming musical comedy, set in turn-of-the-century Paris and based on George Feydeau's classic romp, "Tailleur Pour Dames," turns on a case of mistaken identity, chance meetings and deceptions big and small. Starring Charlotte Rae and Max Wright, this performance was taped in front of a live audience in New York, and was originally broadcast in 1974 as part of the Broadway Theater Archive's efforts to bring stage productions to television.

link.synopsis: Donald Moffat stars in Moliere's classic comedy about lovable scoundrel Tartuffe, who befriends the wealthy Orgon and then attempts to seduce both his new friend's wife and daughter in this TV presentation from the Broadway Theatre Archive. Tartuffe pretends to be a pious man whose faith convinces Orgon and his family to succumb to his influence, but he's undone when his womanizing ways make it clear that his piety is a charade.

link.synopsis: Dramatist Luigi Pirandello's mordant comedy of manners tells the tale of upper-crust Italians Silia Gala (Joan Van Ark) and her sneering spouse, Leone (John McMartin), who finds his impassivity tested when he has to duel his wife's frustrated paramour (David Dukes). Glenn Close and Charles Kimbrough appear in early roles in this witty 1975 production from the Broadway Theatre Archive series of televised plays.

link.synopsis: Soprano Kiri Te Kanawa and baritone Hermann Prey ring in 1984 with this New Year's presentation of Johann Strauss's lighthearted opera from London's Covent Garden. Te Kanawa is Rosalinde, wooed by an admirer as her husband, Gabriel von Eisenstein, is about to be imprisoned. But before he goes, a champagne-drenched ball and mistaken identity result in a comedy of errors. Charles Aznavour makes a cameo appearance and Plácido Domingo directs.

link.synopsis: Recorded at Britain's Glyndebourne Opera Festival, Leos Janacek's opera follows the exploits of Emilia Marty (Anja Silja), a sexually irresistible prima donna who experiences everything imaginable in her long life, which lasts longer than 300 years. Directed by Nikolaus Lehnhoff and conducted by Andrew Davis, this psychological opera blends comedy and personal tragedy to examine the perplexing mystery of human existence.

link.synopsis: Three of the most beloved performers of all time -- Judy Garland, Robert Goulet and Phil Silvers -- share the stage for a delightful evening of singing, dancing and comedy, including splendid performances of "Hello Bluebird" and "Get Happy." The trio also have a ball performing "I'll Go My Way By Myself," "If Ever I Would Leave You" and an extended medley of love songs. The success of this 1963 television special led to Garland's own show.

Irish writer Sean O'Casey wrote his Dublin Trilogy and this play is the first part, set in the 1920s and combining both tragedy and comedy. Features Academy Award winner Richard Dreyfuss and Joe MacGowan.

link.synopsis: John Cheever's wry comedy of errors comes to the screen in this filmed presentation from the Broadway Theatre Archive. An upper-middle-class suburb is turned upside-down by the apparent kidnapping of Toby Wooster (Garrett Hanf). Unaware that the whole thing is a setup, the town swings into action to raise funds to meet the kidnappers' ransom demands. George Grizzard, Polly Holliday, Katharine Balfour and Celeste Holm star.

link.synopsis: When a relative of infamous supervillain Dr. Moriarty sets out to destroy the world, Scotland Yard calls on Sherlock Holmes's bungling, drug-addicted descendent Arthur (John Cleese) to save the day in this offbeat comedy. Despite help from his friend Watson (Arthur Lowe), goofy Arthur can't cut the mustard. With the clock ticking down, Arthur assembles the world's greatest detectives in a last-ditch attempt to stop the diabolical Moriarty.

link.synopsis: Rue McClanahan heads a stellar cast in this filmed-for-PBS production of Thornton Wilder's Pulitzer Prize-winning play about the Antrobus family, a clan whose members have survived floods, pestilence, wars and worse across the eons. Effortlessly blending comedy, drama, and social humor, this presentation directed by Jack O'Brien also stars John Houseman, Blair Brown, Harold Gould and Sada Thompson.

link.synopsis: Comedienne Lisa Lampanelli -- known affectionately as the Queen of Mean -- can be crude, rude and painfully outspoken, but that's all part of her act. And this hourlong show recorded at Rascal's Comedy Club in West Orange, N.J., captures her at her funniest, nastiest best. As the X-rated Lampanelli uncorks her hilarious routine, no topic is too sacred for ridicule -- and neither is anyone in the audience.

link.synopsis: Go behind the scenes of New York's legendary Friars Club, where top comedians have cracked wise and roasted one another with zesty zingers for a half century. The absorbing documentary is a hilarious history of 20th-century American comedy. The film includes audio clips and stills from 1940s and '50s roasts, as well as candid interviews with comic stars Milton Berle, Pat Cooper, Alan King, Janeane Garofalo and more.

link.synopsis: When eager recruit Lon Prentice (Dick Foran) enlists in the Army with bandleader Harry James (playing himself), they discover the place to be is in the USO, where the Andrews Sisters are headlining. With this kind of entertainment, Army life ain't so bad! This amusing World War II-era film effectively blends comedy, propaganda and the Andrews Sisters' wonderful harmonizing on musical numbers such as "Don't Sit Under the Apple Tree."

link.synopsis: Real-life husband and wife Eli Wallach and Anne Jackson portray truck driver Johnny Horton (Wallach) and cigarette girl Eadie (Jackson), who elope after a hasty romance. But after the wedding, the couple realizes they don't know each other very well. Soon Johnny's overbearing mother (Ruth White) becomes the third wheel in their marriage, threatening its fragile existence. Don Richardson directed this classic Broadway comedy.

link.synopsis: No mom is safe in this hidden-camera comedy show hosted by British actor Charles Shaughnessy ("The Nanny"), an all-in-good-fun program that makes mothers the unsuspecting targets of stunts, practical jokes and hilarious setups. It's kind of like "Punk'd" -- only much more maternal. And, when it comes to the scene of the crime, no place is truly off limits. Playing a prank on a mother in her own kitchen, for example, is perfectly acceptable.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Wildly irreverent musician and comic John Valby has made a career out of bringing live piano music mixed with raunchy lyrics and comedy to live audiences around the country, and this video captures "Dr. Dirty" at his vulgar, uncensored best. From classic television shows to sex, nothing is sacred or off-limits, as this equal-opportunity offender time and again proves he's never heard the phrase, "politically correct."

link.synopsis: The joke's on lovers everywhere in this comedy show hosted by British actor Charles Shaughnessy ("The Nanny"), when hidden cameras capture cringe-worthy wedding moments spawned by outrageous pranks, spoofs and third-party setups. The all-in-good-fun program presents an assortment of chuckle-inducing blunders that would be tragic if they weren't so funny, including wedding cake disasters and grooms who can't stay standing.

link.synopsis: The Improv in Los Angeles has showcased many a wisecracker performing now-classic bits on the way up the comedy ladder. This rollicking volume of the series (which includes talent bios) rounds up vintage performances by quipsters Chris Rock, Drew Carey, Jeff Foxworthy, Judy Tenuta and Rosie O'Donnell. Also putting the punch in punch line are Franklin Ajaya, Jack Coen, Stephanie Hodge and John Mulrooney.

Long known as one of the top places to catch comedians poised for stardom, the club has hosted more hilarity than one volume can hold. This fifth volume in the series includes sets by Ellen DeGeneres, D.L. Hughley, Richard Belzer, Will Durst, Larry Miller and many others.

link.synopsis: After flying to France to star in a movie, an American actor (Bruce Campbell) is surprised to discover that the director (Tom Novembre) plans to shoot the entire film at an ice rink. And the fact that most of the crew can't skate is only the beginning of the plagued production's problems. Dolores Chaplin also stars in this multilingual satiric comedy from French director Jean-Philippe Toussaint.

link.synopsis: No matter how hard he tries, Mitch Dobson (Michal Suchánek) can't compete with his soccer-playing older brother, Sean (Shad Hart), who's always the center of attention. When Sean starts dating his sibling's dream girl (Lindsey Brooke), Mitch does everything in his power to end their romance. This enjoyable family comedy also stars Dick Van Patten, Bo Hopkins and Mario López as Sean's soccer coach.

link.synopsis: A homeless man suffers pangs of hunger and fantasizes about having a delicious meal at a nice restaurant. When he finally is able to get his hands on some food, he ends up sharing it with a hungry young boy, and the two outsiders become fast friends. Providing plenty of laughs for this Mexican comedy is the homeless man's incredible foolishness, often missing terrific opportunities that are staring him directly in the face.

link.synopsis: Already the target of bullies, geeky 11-year-old Lloyd's (Todd Bosley) troubles multiply when his classroom antics land him in a special education class for underachievers, where he falls for a cute girl who, in turn, only has eyes for one of Lloyd's tormentors. Can he overcome his nerdy ways with the help of a mentor and win the heart of his true love? Hector Barron directs this comedy that also features Kristen Parker and Tom Arnold.

link.synopsis: When the boss invites himself over for dinner, slime-factory employee Henry Hollowhead (John Glover) smells a promotion. He just has to keep his crazy kids under control and deal with the problem of the boss's crush on Mrs. Hollowhead (Nancy Mette). Juliette Lewis, Lightfield Lewis and Matt Shakman star as the rest of the Hollowhead brood in this futuristic sci-fi comedy by writer, director and prolific makeup artist Thomas R. Burman.

link.synopsis: Four enterprising college seniors pose as graduate researchers and open a phony sex clinic rather than face the prospect of working for a living. But when the workload gets too heavy, they open their "experiments" to paying businessmen. Featuring a young Dennis Quaid, Priscilla Barnes and several other 1970s TV icons, this college sex comedy was directed by Rodney Amateau, creator of the infamously short-lived series "My Mother the Car."

link.synopsis: When he lands a job as a telephone operator, Capulina -- legendary Mexican funnyman Gaspar Henaine -- quickly discovers that he can get the best gossip in town by eavesdropping on callers' private conversations. But when he uses these juicy tidbits to help a local newspaper boost its circulation, he unleashes a firestorm of scandal that threatens to ruin him. Gilberto Martínez Solares directs this comedy.

link.synopsis: A postman finds that his productivity, speed and courage skyrocket once he is forced to eat the magical chili of an insane cook. Beloved Mexican comedian Capulina (aka Gaspar Henaine) keeps the laugh oven set to caliente in this wacky 1970 comedy. Leonorilda Ochoa, Xavier Loyá, Jorge Rado, Víctor Alcocer, Nathaneal León, Julián de Meriche and Jesús Gómez co-star.

link.synopsis: When Capulina -- the alter ego of Mexican comedian Gaspar Henaine -- and some of his friends begin to have bizarre dreams that may reveal the meaning of life, the jokester determines to uncover the secrets of existence once and for all. But he quickly discovers that confronting mummies and other peculiarities of dreamland may make him even crazier than he was before. Alfredo Zacarias directs this comedy that also features Jacqueline Voltaire.

link.synopsis: When he accidentally whacks his head on his daughter's wedding day, uptight ad exec Timothy Westerby (Tom Smothers) causes no end of trouble when he starts chasing the hallucinatory image of a 1920s-era flapper girl (Twiggy) that only he can see. Terry Marcel directs this comedy that also stars Phil Silvers, Jim Backus and Sylvia Syms, based on the play of the same name by John T. Chapman.

link.synopsis: Based on a story by Milan Kundera, this comedy satirizes life in Czechoslovakia under Stalinist rule through the exploits of Ludvik Jahn (Josef Somr), who's thrown out of college and the Communist party for being a jokester. Ludvik is prescribed rehabilitation, but upon his release, seeks revenge against the man who accused him of sending a politically inappropriate postcard. Jana Ditetova and Ludek Munzar co-star.

link.synopsis: Mexican comedians Manuel "Loco" Valdés, Héctor Lechuga and Alejandro Suárez star in this collection of episodes from the popular 1970s sketch comedy series. The show, with such hilarious skits such as "Cosas que Suceden," "Las Aventuras de Vulgarcito," "El Rey y Sus Cavayos," "Los Orates" and "Las Hermans Mibanco," served as a launching pad for the successful careers of many of the cast members. This program is only available in Spanish.
link.title: synopsis
Coleccion Pedro Infante: Asi Era Pedro Infante

link.synopsis: One of the most-watched Mexican TV series, this comedy follows the ups and downs of Juan Felipe Martinez and his amusingly awkward workplace situation. Martinez pretends to be gay to make it in the fashion industry, unknowingly steals a job from his ex-girlfriend and (as if that weren't enough) becomes her manager. Hèctor Suàrez Gomìs and Chantal Andere star. Please note: This is a Spanish-only title.
link.title: synopsis
Ricky Martin: Live: Black & White Tour

link.synopsis: Alfonso Zayas stars as "El Bibi," a shameless construction worker who spends his days inventing new ways of "complimenting" the beautiful ladies who pass by the site. But when one of those women turns out to be a police officer, our hero is trouble. The lady cop turns the tables on El Bibi and his similarly vocal friends in this Mexican popular comedy. Maribel Fernández co-stars.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Flo the fly (voiced by Vicki Lawrence) has developed a bad habit: She makes up tall tales and passes them off as the truth -- but when her friends find out Flo has been fibbing to them, they stop trusting her. It's up to Hermie and the rest of the gang to teach Flo the importance of honesty in this entertaining animated fable that also features the voices of comedy legends Tim Conway and Don Knotts.

link.synopsis: While mob boss Frankie Diomede (Lee Van Cleef) awaits execution in prison, his criminal empire is destroyed methodically by a rival French gangster. With the help of a small-time crook named Tony (Tony Lo Bianco), Frankie breaks out of prison and goes looking for his enemies. Full of action, suspense and comedy, this 1970s Italian film follows the adventures of Frankie and Tony as they head over to France.

link.synopsis: From the Ultimate Ninja Collection comes Ninja: The Final Duel, a classic martial arts tale that combines action-packed drama with satiric comedy. When Japanese monk Wang Chi Chung (Alexander Lo) travels to China to study at the Shaolin Temple, he finds himself drawn into a battle with bloodthirsty ninjas who attack the temple. Along the way, Chung encounters flying ninja water spiders, gay Hare Krishnas and the infamous Black Monk of Harlem.

link.synopsis: When he takes over his father's business, Edward (Richard Cromwell) has no idea what he's in for. link.synopsis: When the traveling circus comes to town, misbehaving Billy (Tommy Kelly) and a bunch of his mischievous neighborhood pals stop by for a visit and get into loads of trouble with the circus promoter, a female lion-tamer and others. link.synopsis: When Ben Green (Mike Binder) moves to London to write for a popular TV sitcom, the show's star, Carly (Mariel Hemingway), decides to play matchmaker to the lonely American and fixes him up with makeup artist Fiona (Irene Jacob). But complications arise when Carly becomes romantically curious about Ben. Meanwhile, her husband (Colin Firth) secretly lusts after Fiona. Binder also directed this comedy where lust is fleeting and love is fickle.

link.synopsis: Lum and Abner (Chester Lauck and Norris Goff, reprising their popular radio roles) journey from Arkansas to Chicago, where they must earn a big wad of money fast if they want to claim a railroad they've inherited. Complicating matters, Abner is mistakenly diagnosed with a terminal illness and agrees to perform a series of idiotic stunts so he can claim a big paycheck. The nutty slapstick comedy also stars Franklin Pangborn as Mr. Pinkney.
